remarks: Two points that satisfy the conclusion of ~ axtgsegcon are identical.  Uniqueness portion of Theorem 2.12 of [Schwabhauser] p. 29.  (Contributed by Thierry Arnoux, 23-Mar-2019.)
statement:
tkgeom.p $e |- P = ( Base ` G ) $.
tkgeom.d $e |- .- = ( dist ` G ) $.
tkgeom.i $e |- I = ( Itv ` G ) $.
tkgeom.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. TarskiG ) $.
tgcgrextend.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.d $e |- ( ph -> D e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. P ) $.
tgcgrextend.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. P ) $.
tgsegconeq.1 $e |- ( ph -> D =/= A ) $.
tgsegconeq.2 $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( D I E ) ) $.
tgsegconeq.3 $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( D I F ) ) $.
tgsegconeq.4 $e |- ( ph -> ( A .- E ) = ( B .- C ) ) $.
tgsegconeq.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( A .- F ) = ( B .- C ) ) $.
tgsegconeq $p |- ( ph -> E = F ) $.
